title: Cody Simpson serenades Miley Cyrus with Elvis Presley track
text:
Cody Simpson and Miley Cyrus enjoyed a cosy night in (Picture: Instagram/GC Images)

Cody Simpson and Miley Cyrus’ whirlwind romance is showing no signs of slowing down.

Miley is now dating the Australian star, following her split from ex-girlfriend Kaitlynn Carter, and it looks like the pair are pretty smitten.

So much so, that they enjoyed a cosy night in on Sunday while watching Elvis Presley videos and serenading each other.

Cody took to his Instagram story with a black and white video of himself and Miley cuddled up together on the sofa and looking very comfortable together.

With his arm wrapped around Miley, Cody flashed a smile while singing the lyric ‘more today than yesterday’ from Elvis hit, Ku-u-i-po.

Cody shared a video of him serenading Miley (Picture: Instagram)

News of his romance with Miley first surfaced earlier this week, when she reposted footage a fan had taken of the couple kissing.

Miley was faced with criticism from some, accusing her of ‘moving on too quickly’, as she had only just announced her split from Kaitlynn.

The Wrecking Ball hit-maker began dating Brody Jenner’s ex just days after confirming her separation from husband Liam Hemsworth – who she is now in the process of divorcing.

Hitting back, Miley refused to be ‘slut-shamed’ as she urged people to ‘get used’ to her dating.

Miley and Cody’s romance was revealed by a fan (Picture: Instagram)

She vented her frustration over living out her love life in the public eye and hit back at double standards in the entertainment industry.

Miley argued her male counterparts rarely get ‘slut-shamed’ for their actions, while women are slated for moving on from a relationship quickly.

Referencing the breakdown of her eight-month marriage to Liam, who she dated for 10 years on and off, Miley tweeted: ‘I know the public feels invested in my past relationship because they felt like they saw it thru from the beginning.

‘I think that’s why people have always felt so entitled over my life and how I live it because they’ve watched me grow up. But I am grown now and make choices as an adult know the truth/details/reality.’

She added: ‘This “dating” thing is new to me too. I’ve never been an ‘adult’/grown ass woman experiencing this.

‘I was in a committed relationship for almost all my teens and early 20s, with the exception of a few breaks, which usually in those times I was working my a** off with not much R&R… PLEASE don’t make this awkward for me.’
